meanings.definition: To have a more pleasing taste than something else.
meanings.sent1: The chocolate cake will outsavor the plain vanilla cake at the party.
meanings.sent2: I hope my homemade cookies outsavor the store-bought ones.
meanings.sent3: The spicy salsa outsavored the mild guacamole at the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outsavored the sound of the crashing waves on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread outsavored all other scents in the bakery.

meanings.definition: To surpass in flavor or taste.
meanings.sent1: The chef's special sauce will outsavor any other condiment on the table.
meanings.sent2: The exotic spices in the dish outsavor the usual ingredients we use.
meanings.sent3: The bold flavors of the dish outsavored the diner's expectations.
meanings.sent4: Her voice outsavored the melody of the song, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The rich, creamy texture of the dessert outsavored any dessert I had tasted before.
